urls.title: How to fix the sizes in your ggplots
urls.description: Helpful resources:- Camcorder package: https://github.com/thebioengineer/camcorder- Excellent blog post about sizes and resolutions: https://www.christopheni...

tweets.text:
Exporting ggplots without worrying about size issues? That's easy with the {camcorder} package!

Call gg_record() when you start visualizing and ALL plots are exported. Nothing changes when you're finished.

Check out this vid for a full breakdown: https://t.co/MPFaRGTeR7 #rstats https://t.co/7JhSPA3pWj

urls.title: R Syntax Mode in JASP: The First Button - JASP - Free and User-Friendly Statistical Software
urls.description: With the release of JASP 0.17, a new button has been added to the menus for the core analyses. In addition to renaming, duplicating, deleting an analysis and viewing the help file, JASP users now have access to the underlying… Continue reading →

tweets.text:
Did you notice a cool new button has been added to JASP? Our latest and exciting new feature, the R Syntax mode now allows you to access the underlying function call in R for your analyses!

Learn more about how to use R Syntax on our blogpost here: https://t.co/g4kk5v9sMN
